meanings.definition: To spend more money than is saved.
meanings.sent1: She kept dissaving her allowance on toys.
meanings.sent2: He realized he was dissaving when his bank account dwindled.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel dissaving all its nuts for a big feast.
meanings.sent4: Her impulsive shopping habits were dissaving her future.
meanings.sent5: The leaky faucet was dissaving water every minute.

meanings.sent1: His dissaving led to financial troubles.
meanings.sent2: The dissaving affected their plans for a vacation.
meanings.sent3: The dissaving jar seemed to have a hole in it.
meanings.sent4: The dissaving trend worried the financial advisor.
meanings.sent5: The dissaving was evident in the empty piggy bank.
